title: Crowds Watch Israeli Airstrikes from a Beirut Hillside
content: Every night, dozens gather at the hillside to watch airstrikes rain down on the city’s southern suburbs. The ritual offers a window into the war — and proof that the once unimaginable is really happening.
summary: Every night, dozens gather at the hillside to watch airstrikes rain down on the city’s southern suburbs. The ritual offers a window into the war — and proof that the once unimaginable is really happening.

title: Netanyahu Signals Openness to Israel-Hezbollah Cease-Fire, Officials Say
content: The United States is pushing Israel to reach a deal with the Lebanese militia by Thanksgiving, even as key details remained unresolved, Israeli officials said.
summary: The United States is pushing Israel to reach a deal with the Lebanese militia by Thanksgiving, even as key details remained unresolved, Israeli officials said.

title: DHL Cargo Plane Crashes Near Airport in Lithuania, Killing 1
content: The crash near Vilnius Airport sparked a fire in a residential area, officials said. One person on board was killed and three others were hospitalized.
summary: The crash near Vilnius Airport sparked a fire in a residential area, officials said. One person on board was killed and three others were hospitalized.

title: Surge of Gang Violence in Haiti Leads U.N. Workers to Flee
content: A surge in gang violence over the past two weeks has led international aid organizations to rethink their staff levels in Haiti.
summary: A surge in gang violence over the past two weeks has led international aid organizations to rethink their staff levels in Haiti.

title: UAE Arrests 3 in Connection With Murder of Israeli Rabbi
content: Israeli authorities say the abduction and killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan was an act of antisemitic terrorism, but investigators have not yet stated a motive.
summary: Israeli authorities say the abduction and killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan was an act of antisemitic terrorism, but investigators have not yet stated a motive.

title: Protesters Defy Pakistan Crackdown to Demand Imran Khan’s Release
content: Supporters of the ex-prime minister marched toward Islamabad, the capital. Clashes with the police left at least one officer dead, the authorities said.
summary: Supporters of the ex-prime minister marched toward Islamabad, the capital. Clashes with the police left at least one officer dead, the authorities said.

title: Hard-Right Candidate Wins First Round of Romania’s Presidential Election
content: Calin Georgescu, who had been widely dismissed as a fringe candidate, won the most votes on Sunday with 22.9 percent. He will face a more centrist opponent in the second round on Dec. 8.
summary: Calin Georgescu, who had been widely dismissed as a fringe candidate, won the most votes on Sunday with 22.9 percent. He will face a more centrist opponent in the second round on Dec. 8.

title: Philippines President Slams Vice President’s Assassination Plot
content: Political turmoil has escalated after Vice President Sara Duterte claimed to have arranged for President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr.’s assassination if she is slain.
summary: Political turmoil has escalated after Vice President Sara Duterte claimed to have arranged for President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr.’s assassination if she is slain.

title: U.K. Man Fighting for Ukraine Is Said to Be Captured in Russia
content: Russian state media reported that a British volunteer for the Ukrainian Army was captured amid fighting in the Kursk region.
summary: Russian state media reported that a British volunteer for the Ukrainian Army was captured amid fighting in the Kursk region.

title: Spain Flooding: Why Did It Take So Long to Warn Residents?
content: Torrential rains in Valencia, in eastern Spain, caused flooding that killed more than 200 people. The deluge started inland. It took the authorities hours to warn those downstream.
summary: Torrential rains in Valencia, in eastern Spain, caused flooding that killed more than 200 people. The deluge started inland. It took the authorities hours to warn those downstream.

title: Palestinians See Echoes of Israel’s Gaza War in West Bank Raids
content: West Bank residents say Israeli forces are adopting tactics similar to the ones they are deploying in Gaza, including airstrikes and the use of Palestinians as human shields.
summary: West Bank residents say Israeli forces are adopting tactics similar to the ones they are deploying in Gaza, including airstrikes and the use of Palestinians as human shields.

title: Rabbi Found Dead in Dubai in What Israel Calls Terrorist Act
content: The Israeli authorities called the killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan an act of terrorism. The Emirati government said it had arrested three people in connection with the murder.
summary: The Israeli authorities called the killing of Rabbi Zvi Kogan an act of terrorism. The Emirati government said it had arrested three people in connection with the murder.

title: What Two Acclaimed Female-Directed Movies Say About Indian Cinema
content: “Laapataa Ladies” and “All We Imagine as Light” have both captivated audiences at home. But only one was able to get India’s nod for the best foreign film Oscar.
summary: “Laapataa Ladies” and “All We Imagine as Light” have both captivated audiences at home. But only one was able to get India’s nod for the best foreign film Oscar.

title: The Problem of Sorcery in Papua New Guinea
content: Tragedies in Papua New Guinea are often followed by accusations of sorcery and unspeakable acts of violence. That cycle has become more brutal in recent years.
summary: Tragedies in Papua New Guinea are often followed by accusations of sorcery and unspeakable acts of violence. That cycle has become more brutal in recent years.

title: Fentanyl Rises Again, This Time as Trump’s Diplomatic Weapon Against China

summary: The president-elect’s pledge to use tariffs to stem the flow of opioids from China could backfire if Beijing responds by ending counternarcotics cooperation.

title: FIFA President’s Bet on Club World Cup Meets Reality

summary: Gianni Infantino has tied his legacy to the 32-team tournament, even inscribing his name on the trophy. Its success is far from guaranteed.

title: As Russia Advances in Ukraine, a Cop Has to Flee City After City

title: Egypt Feuds With Travel Blogger, Issuing 1,100-Word Response to Complaints

title: Brazil Cracked Down on Corruption. Now It’s Undoing the Case.

title: 2-Year-Old Gorilla Dies After Being Struck by Hydraulic Door at Zoo
content: A Calgary Zoo staff member mistakenly activated a door that struck the western lowland gorilla named Eyare, a report found.

title: Madeleine Riffaud, ‘the Girl Who Saved Paris,’ Dies at 100
content: Humiliated by a Nazi officer as a teenager, she joined the French Resistance. By the time she was 20, she had killed a German soldier, survived torture and captured a supply train.
summary: Humiliated by a Nazi officer as a teenager, she joined the French Resistance. By the time she was 20, she had killed a German soldier, survived torture and captured a supply train.

title: What’s Behind Ukraine and Russia’s Missile Brinkmanship?
content: Tit-for-tat moves this week included the use of American-made ballistic missiles to strike inside Russia, and new nuclear threats from Moscow. Neither appear to have influenced the war on the ground.
summary: Tit-for-tat moves this week included the use of American-made ballistic missiles to strike inside Russia, and new nuclear threats from Moscow. Neither appear to have influenced the war on the ground.

title: In South Africa, Food Poisoning Kills at Least 23 Children

title: Alberta Breaks With the Canadian Pension Model
content: The provincial government abruptly purged the board and senior leaders of Alberta’s pension fund, defying a long-held principle that funds should be free of political interference.
summary: The provincial government abruptly purged the board and senior leaders of Alberta’s pension fund, defying a long-held principle that funds should be free of political interference.

summary: The police in the state of Tasmania said all other efforts to help the man, a foreign tourist in his 60s, failed before the decision was made to amputate.

title: With Memes and in State Media, Many Russians Cheer on Putin’s Threats

title: How a Nigerian Nurse Abducted by Boko Haram Planned Her Escape

title: Israel Strike Against Hezbollah in Lebanon Kills at Least 20

title: Formula for Power in Modi’s India: Cash, Detentions and Luxe Resorts
content: With a tactic known as “resort politics,” Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party has been accused of using brute force to take over Indian state governments.
